intro: Palicourea cyanantha, commonly known as blue-eyed blackroot, is a striking tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its showy, blue-violet flowers. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a glossy surface and emits a mild, aromatic scent. Its unique appearance and ornamental value make it a sought-after species in horticulture. However, it is important to note that some species in this genus contain toxic compounds, so handling should be done with care.
